column2: All good [Root.Religion.GetName] share in an egalitarian society - have you done your part?
This ruler gravitates excessive wealth and loves power - why doesn't he or she distribute is gains like a proper man of the people? Fellow Populists are distrustful of this ruler.
This ruler supports an oppressive hierarchy, one that wallows in luxury. If he or she doesn't redistribute the wealth soon, other Populists might have to "purge" him or her!
This ruler is irredeemably corrupt - power-hungry, repressive, and greedy beyond measure. All of his or her realm, there is talk of "purging" him or her... permanently.
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can plunder and conquer the lands held by the corrupt §Y$TARGET$§! and purify them of such filth..

The Dulcinian movement was a religious sect of the Late Middle Ages, originating within the Apostolic Brethren. The Dulcinians, or Dulcinites, and Apostolics were inspired by Franciscan ideals and influenced by the Joachimites, but were considered heretical by the Catholic Church. They espoused the end of feudalism, redistribution and sharing of wealth and power, and an egalitarian society. They were also notorious for their raids and plundering, and senseless slaughter of innocents, justified in their view because they the believers were pure and those who accepted the Church were corrupt beyond salvation.\n\nIn game, the Dulcinians can raid, have female temple holders, and a pope. They also have access to a special CB usable on "corrupt" Christians, but cannot go above low crown authority. Additionally, Dulcinian rulers who hoard gold or have low crown authority will suffer massive malus.
[Root.Religion.GetName] do not believe in tyrannical rulership!
Rome has been purified of the corrupt Church! Now it is time to herald the new holy Pope, who will lead us spiritually in opposition to the sinful Catholic Pope!
This Fraticelli character is part of the Relaxati or moderate faction.
This Fraticelli character is part of the Zelanti or conservative faction.

This character is a member of the Secular Franciscan Order, a community of Catholic men and women in the world who seek to pattern their lives after Christ in the spirit of St. Francis of Assisi. Pax et bonum!
This character, with great spiritual convinction, spends his or her life traveling the countryside, preaching the true faith to the masses.

The Fraticelli faithful are divided into two camps when it comes to the issues of poverty and humility among the clergy and devout. Some, calling themselves the Relaxati, or Conventuals, believe in moderation and in living in settled areas to help the poor - extreme poverty can only go so far, otherwise, how can the Fraticelli way spread? Others, calling themselves the Zelanti, or Spirituals, take a hardline approach, arguing that strict vows of poverty and a solitary, spartan lifestyle are needed for the survival of the faith. While the two groups don't necessarily hate each other, their differing views do put them at odds.
I feel the practical, charitable Relaxati are right.
The beliefs of the austere Zelanti have more merit.
Perhaps the Zelanti's severe ideology is too extreme, and the Relaxati focus on charity and helping others is truer to Fraticelli doctrine...
I have made the right choice.
Perhaps the "moderate" Relaxati have misunderstood the Fraticelli faith, and the more conservative Zelanti have a better understanding of the Fraticelli faith...
I have made the right choice.

One of your courtiers has decided to devote a good amount of the year traveling the realm in extreme poverty, preaching the Gospel to all who will listen, be they peasants, soldiers, nobles, or even animals. Their spiritual credentials should serve them well.
May much benefit come from our faith.

The Order of the Secular Franciscans are an order dedicated to the Fraticelli faith. It is open to anybody not bound by religious vows to another Religious Order and is made up of both the laity and secular clergy. While its members are not bound by public vows like those who are part of religious orders living in community, they are just as dedicated to the tenets of the Fraticelli faith.\n\nI wish to join the Secular Franciscans and dedicate my life to the betterment of the world and the glory of God. I will observe the Gospel and live according to it for all my life.
Will you join the Order of the Secular Franciscans, and devote your life to God and the Franciscan way?
The zealous [Root.Religion.GetName] nobles of your realm are unhappy with your oppressive, extravagant regime. If you don't redistribute the wealth soon, they might consider "purifying" you soon...
The zealous [Root.Religion.GetName] clergy of your realm are unhappy with your oppressive, extravagant regime. If you don't redistribute the wealth soon, they might consider "purifying" you soon...
The zealous [Root.Religion.GetName] burghers of your realm are unhappy with your oppressive, extravagant regime. If you don't redistribute the wealth soon, they might consider "purifying" you soon...
The zealous [Root.Religion.GetName] peasants of your realm are unhappy with your oppressive, extravagant regime. If you don't redistribute the wealth soon, they might consider "purifying" you soon...

This ruler gravitates excessive wealth and loves power - why doesn't he or she give it to the needy and poor like a good Dulcinian? All of his or her realm, nobles talk of "purifying" him or her... even permanently, if necessary.
